notes.text:
An update for libjpeg-turbo is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The libjpeg-turbo packages contain a library of functions for manipulating JPEG images. They also contain simple client programs for accessing the libjpeg functions. These packages provide the same functionality and API as libjpeg but with better performance.

Security Fix(es):

* libjpeg-turbo: heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability in decompress_smooth_data in jdcoefct.c (CVE-2021-29390)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.4 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A heap buffer over-read flaw was found in libjpeg-turbo. For certain types of smoothed jpeg images, the decompress_smooth_data() function may improperly enter a condition statement that leads to heap memory read of uninitialized data, which may cause an application crash or loss of confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libjpeg-turbo: heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability in decompress_smooth_data in jdcoefct.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The amount of memory read is very small and not controllable by an attacker, which lowers the impact of this flaw to Moderate.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libjpeg-turbo: heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability in decompress_smooth_data in jdcoefct.c
